feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Timer Integrations in CPI, having null/unix epoch time in
entry.content:
I have a timer based integration which runs only once daily,  I use exception subprocess and mail adapter to log errors, and for some reason my emails coming as makred as striked saying "This message expired on Wednesday, December 31, 1969 7:00 PM."

I tried to manually pass current date as headers using custom headers but it's still not taking the time,

Does anyone faced any similar situations??

entry.title: MustUnderstand headers are not understood
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

For integration from Microsoft Application (MS) against SAP ERP system via SAP Cloud Integration system starts got error when  MS side call SOAP service interface after being working well in the last month, the issue starts getting this week on SAP CI Production.

We analysed in detail the issue and we found the followings:

  • the failed messages sent from MS side are not listed in the SAP CI Monitor; just it is found the entries related to the error in the http and trace files:

Entry of HTTP File:

x.x.x.x (x.x.x.x) - - [11/09/2025:10:11:19 +0000] "POST /cxf/productionorder/update HTTP/1.1" 401 104ms - -

Entry of Trace File at 11.09.25: respect to 10:11:19:

2025-09-11 10:11:19#+0000#INFO#com.sap.it.security.multicloud.authentication.AuthConfigurationFactory#anonymous#http-nio2-8080-exec-13#com.sap.it.security.multicloud.authentication#na#na#na#na#Neither client certificate nor Authorization header found. Returning  no auth type#f747460a-2903-477f-5106-92aad8cb5cf7#x.x.x.x#1

  • we have checked that MS Test and Production systems have the SAP CI SSL certificates.
  • we have tested the SOAP Service Interface via Postman manually, and it is got error processing "mustUnderstand=1" attribute as part of the Header of the Payload, based on the error message displayed on Postman:

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">    <soap:Body>        <soap:Fault>            <faultcode>soap:MustUnderstand</faultcode>            <faultstring>MustUnderstand headers: [{http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2005/05/addressing/none}Action] are not understood.</faultstring>        </soap:Fault>    </soap:Body></soap:Envelope>

Nothing was changed (WSDL definition related to the SOAP Service Update Production Order interface or SW update on MA Production side).

We don´t understand why the SOAP Sender Adapter (Communication Channel) is not able to process the new messages suddenly even though have the same structure/content; the "mustUnderstand=1"  Attribute/Value was well process before. This interface was running well on Production until last week.

Any help or hint will be appreciate. Thanks in advance.

Best Regards,

Maria Orellana

entry.title: Does SAPIS have the capability to connect with PostgreSQL DB hosted on Bastion server via SSH tunnel
entry.content:
Dear Integration Experts,

We are working on a requirement to fetch data from a PostgreSQL database that is hosted on the Bastion server. The DB Admin team is requesting us to connect via SSH Tunneling. They have also shared a PEM file to be used during the connection.

In SAP IS, we do not see any configuration to enable SSH tunneling or use the PEM File in the DB connection. I have searched the entire SAP community and did not find any options to enable connection to DB via SSH tunneling.

Has anyone come across such a requirement? Any workarounds or approaches that can be explored to enable this connectivity?

Edit (1): Just wanted to add that we were able to connect to the DB via DBeaver (by configuring SSH Tunnel and PEM File import).

Regards,

Prajeet

entry.title: Implementing OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

  • We would appreciate guidance on setting this up, specifically:

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

    2. How to configure it when an application (rather than users) needs to consume SuccessFactors APIs.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande 

Regards,
Pavan

entry.title: Integration Suite OData PATCH
entry.content:
Hi,

I am struggling for quite some time to sole issues regarding OData services. Now my problem is with Sales Order Item. I want to change Reject Reason in item, but with OData adapter.

This is my connection:

processing:

Content Modifier before:

 

This is from log:
odata:PATCH_ENTRY?serviceUri=${exchangeProperty.endpoint}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/
&resourcePath=RAW(A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='0000000578',SalesOrderItem='000010'))
&alias=RAW(CUC_BO_SO_0109)
&authenticationType=Basic
&retrieveAllPages=true
&oDataMethod=PATCH_ENTRY
&contentType=application/atom+xml
&componentContentType=xml
&receiveTimeOut=60000&proxyType=default
&SystemQueryOption=RAW(sap-client=100&$format=json)
&retryOnFailure=false
&allowRequestHeaders=false
&setErrorResponseBody=true
&isKeyAutoGenerated=true
&allowResponseHeaders=false
&isCSRFEnabled=true
&serviceType=HCIOData&allowHttpSuccessPassThrough=true
&adapterVersion=1.26.0
&whitelistRequestHeaders=RAW(Accept:application/atom+xml|If-Match:*|content-type:application/atom+xml;type=entry)
&validateSystemQueryOption=true
&enableTLSSessionReuse=true
&enableMPLAttachments=false
&enableKeyManagerCache=true

 

And at the end error:

Error Details
com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Request Payload Parsing Failed for one of the reason: (1) Either the OData metadata content available in the server is outdated OR (2) The request payload seems to be incorrect. Error Details : Entity Set entry not found in the edmx.

Thank you

entry.title: : Cloud Integration: HTTP 500 when opening Message Processing Log (MPL) in Monitor → Message Process
entry.content: In SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration), I’m getting an error when trying to open the Message Processing Log for an iFlow from Monitor → Message Processing.

entry.title: OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"

    ************************

Key Requirements:

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande @

Pavan

entry.title: OData API Reference for Phone Numbers in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am looking for an OData API Reference currently available in SAP SuccessFactors. I am planning to create an integration for which I need to know the structure of the employee phone record in SuccessFactors. For this I am in need of a reference as to what is currently available in OData API for phone numbers.

Please suggest where can I get the documentation / reference for OData API for phone numbers.

Thanks in advance

Arul

entry.title: Edge Integration Cell Vs Kafka On-premise
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We have SAP Integration Cell deployed on Azure. Everything is working correctly. Now we want to connect to our on-premise Kafka 2.1 server on Linux.

We've developed a simple test interface in CPI. We are using the Kafka adapter, which asks for an authentication type. Our Kafka server doesn't have any authentication defined; we only filter by IP.

Even with the rules enabled to allow connectivity from the Azure Integration Cell, we are the same error.

The test button from Monitor "Connectivity Test" also gives the same error.

Any suggestions?

java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting for a node assignment. Call: listTopics Cause: org.apache.kafka.common.errors.TimeoutException: Timed out waiting for a node assignment. Call: listTopics

Thanks

entry.title: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content:
Hi,

Anyone have tried integrating from hookdeck to CPI IFlow? What's the Authentication method you use to connect? We have tried using OAuth2(Client Credentials) however it seems like it's not fetching or generating the token from the credentials (service key created in BTP) and getting 401 however when we use Bearer Token and manually input it, it works and is sending to the iFlow successfully.

Has anyone encountered this or what other ways of authentication method can you suggest?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to use bdwreferencerequest_in inside a SAP Integration suite iflow for POST operation
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a requirement to create a billing document based on input SalesOrderID. This has to be done inside AP Integration suite (BTP).I looked through various options including oData v4 which does not allows this:

        "message": "Creating operations are disabled for entity '$SRVD_A2X#API_BILLINGDOCUMENT~A_BILLINGDOCUMENT_2'",

 So I narrowed down to SOAP API, bdwreferencerequest_in. However my integration suite is failing at this POST step with unclear error message. Can someone please explain what should be the URL, required configurations and sample payload for this request.

https://api.sap.com/api/BDWREFERENCEREQUEST_IN/overview

#SAP BTP SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Provision of Sales Cloud V2 APIs via Integration Suite and Cloud Connector for on-prem clients
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

As part of our ongoing platform transformation, we are migrating to Sales Cloud V2 and S/4HANA. Initial testing within our sandbox environment has confirmed successful access to the Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

For productive use, we aim to establish a secure and scalable integration architecture by leveraging SAP Integration Suite in conjunction with the Cloud Connector. This setup is intended to enable on-premise clients to proactively consume Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

The envisioned scenario involves external calls initiated from on-prem systems, with responses returned from the cloud — for example, accessing data related to the Business Partner object.

We would like to validate whether this architecture is technically feasible and aligns with best practices for hybrid connectivity and secure API exposure.

entry.title: Unable to see the "Manage Security" option under "Monitor" menu in SAP Integration Suite trial accou
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am not able to see the "Manage Security" option under "Monitor" menu in SAP Integration Suite trial account. 

I am interested to know what options are available in "Manage Security" - but that is not showing up for me.

Please let me know how I can get that option.

Thanks

Arul

entry.title: Error eDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I hope you are doing very well. Today I have a question regarding an Electronic Invoicing integration that I am developing. I have S4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION, Integration Suite as middleware, and EFACT as the electronic invoicing provider. What happens is that from S4 an XML is generated that will be sent to EFACT, but before sending it I need to transform the XML into the structure they expect and then send it to them in a file. This part is not the issue, I just mention it to give context.

The problem is that when I trigger the process from the eDocument Cockpit, I get these errors. However, if I check in Integration Suite, it shows as completed and I can see the response returned by the electronic provider. Has any of you experts experienced a similar situation?

Regards.

entry.title: JIRA to SAP CALM via SAP Integration Suite
entry.content: We are planning to establish an integration between Jira and SAP Cloud ALM using the SAP Integration Suite. Kindly provide the detailed connection setup and configuration guide, including any prerequisites, authentication methods, message mapping, and error handling best practices necessary for a seamless data exchange.

entry.title: Event Mesh activation not possible in Integration Suite - free plan
entry.content:
Hello!

I am trying to set up the Manage Business Events Capability in Integration Suite - free plan

I am able to activate the capability, but when trying to activate Event Mesh (Configure -> Event Mesh) I get a message that it was set up ok but the Event Mesh shows the "failed" sign. In the queues it shows "Event mesh activation failed. Please try again."

I found note 0003527095 which references this error, but the suggested solution "To resolve this issue, the Event Mesh default plan must be removed from the subaccount." does not apply here, I have not added the Event Mesh default plan to the sub-account and still get the error.

I am wondering if the Event Mesh can even be used from the Integration Suite - free plan (I am using a PAYG global account with only the Integration Suite - free added for the subaccount).

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thanks!

entry.title: Download iFlow with integration content API without merging configured values with defaults
entry.content:
I'm using this API: https://api.sap.com/api/IntegrationContent/overview

When i call /IntegrationDesigntimeArtifacts(Id='{Id}',Version='{Version}')/$value the API seems to merge the configured values with the default values. Is it possible to get the integration flow with just the default values?

When I try to download an integration flow by using the regular UI, both options are available:

entry.title: ServiceKey grant permissions to only specific iflows ?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I have a general question regarding the SAP Integration Suite.

Currently, we generate a ServiceKey to allow HTTP access to our iFlows from outside. Is there a way to restrict HTTP access using the ServiceKey to only specific iFlows?

As we understand it, a single ServiceKey currently grants access to all endpoints, which can be a security concern. Are there any best practices or configuration options to limit access for a ServiceKey to specific iFlows only? Thank you very much in advance for your support!

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: SAP BTP Integration Suite learning exercise
entry.content:
Hi,

I am getting below error while trying to access https://sapes5.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/GWSAMPLE_BASIC/ProductSet(HT-1000) from the SAP BTP Integration Suite learning exercise.

 

<SAP_Transaction>For backend administrators: use ADT feed reader "SAP Gateway Error Log" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details</SAP_Transaction>
<SAP_Note>See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)</SAP_Note>
 
And If I try to access the link from SAP_Note --> https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736
I am getting below message -
 
No data
Unable to fetch data at the moment. This might be due to a server error or a network issue. Please try again later.
 
Please let me know how to resolve this.
